website_summaries.verdict: While the Secure Loop design may not be a perfect fit for every ear, the Bowers & Wilkins C5s are among the best-sounding earphones in their sub-$200 price class.
pros: The Bowers & Wilkins C5 earphones offer clean, detailed, natural sound with tight bass

They feature an integrated microphone with navigation controls for cell-phone use, and an eye-catching industrial design with an innovative adjustable Secure Loop keeps the earphones securely in your ears
cons: The Secure Loop design isn't universally comfortable (doesn't work well in all ears) and the in-line remote is designed to work only with Apple iOS devices, not Android smartphones

customer_reviews.title: Broken multiple times
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the fragile chord but could not have been more pleased with the sound quality of these headphones after I purchased them. Unfortunately, within 6 months of ordinary use they stopped working--if the chord shifted at all, the sound would cut out. So I returned them under warranty and B&W sent me a new pair. Within 6 months of very limited use and even more careful care, they once again stopped working--the sound would cut out in the right speaker after 15 minutes use. B&W refuses to give refunds, so I am stuck in an endless cycle of using and returning these now...a huge hassle. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jamal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound, Stay in Ears
customer_reviews.text: The best headphones I have ever owned. I wear them on my commute through NYC every day for a few hours and inevitably I have broken a few pairs. Every time I go back tho. The sounds is amazing; I have heard portions of music In songs I have known for decades that these headphones allow me to hear. It's relavatory. If you wear headphones as long as I do every day (3+ hours) you should invest in good ones. These are the ones for me.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Best earbud ever
customer_reviews.text: OK I admit I have not listened to every earbud available in the $200+ category, but after buying these I don't feel the need to. The sound is simply stellar: clear, balanced, open, and with great bass when the buds are correctly positioned. The in-ear loops are a little odd, but surprisingly effective. They stick out more than some other styles. But if you have ever heard sound reproduced by other B&W speakers you will recognize these in-ear headphones as having that "cut above" character to them as well. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound Good
customer_reviews.text: Best thing about these earbuds is innovative wearing technique. They have a metal loop that goes inside the ear, I find this much more comfortable than cable over the ear such as Shure brand I was using before. Fit is snug and secure with variety of ear tips to get the best fit. Sound is good, not sure if its any better than the Shure's or not, didn't A/B compare and must go from memory. Wasn't struck by a great difference. I usually wear them only on long flights so comfort and unique approach do well.
customer_reviews.author: Music Aficionado

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous sound!
customer_reviews.text: The Bowers & Wilkins C5 in-ear headphones are a delight to hear. I've had my set for a few months and they continue to amaze me with their sonic accuracy. Bass is strong but not boomy or emphasized. It is imperative that the owner try all of the four sizes of ear pieces to find the optimum fit. Bass is severely compromised with a poor fit. The C5s sound as good as my $8,000 speakers. Classical music--both orchestral and piano--are well-presented. Rock music sounds fine also. I doubt anyone would fault the C5, especially at their price.
customer_reviews.author: RonC

customer_reviews.title: I thoroughly enjoy these headphones in terms of fit and sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I thoroughly enjoy these headphones in terms of fit and sound quality. The fatal flaw is the durability in that after a few months (3-4), the audio starts to drop or crackle with movement of the cord. The short term pleasure is replaced by the long term pain. The issue for me is I get it replaced and keep falling victim to the same cycle. I am not abusing the headphones in any way so it is ridiculous for it to be so fragile given the relatively higher price.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Da Breau

customer_reviews.title: There is nothing close to this performance at this price
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. They sound amazing over a large variety of genres. The fit is good for me, however I don't have the cable pushed all the way up into the folds of my ear. Doing so causes a little fatigue. The rubber plug portion provides a tight enough fit that the buds remain securely in my ear. They block a surprising amount of ambient noise, way better than the (albeit cheaper) Sony and Apple earbuds I've used prior. The in-line remote works as promised for the iPod and does provide some functionality with Android.
customer_reviews.author: Campbell

customer_reviews.title: or this was just a bad pair of head phones
customer_reviews.text: These were the nicest ear buds, or headphones, for that matter, that my wife or I had ever tried. They produce incredible sound. My wife used them 2x for triathlon training (running) and the right ear stopped working. We're not sure if the sweat killed them, or this was just a bad pair of head phones. We decided to use another set made for athletics and returned these.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cowdell

customer_reviews.title: They even hold up to a full wash/dry cycle...
customer_reviews.text: In addition to having great sound quality and pretty decent ability to block out extraneous sounds (for both you and the person on the other end of the microphone, these hold up impressively well. I WASHED AND DRIED these today (terrifying accident) and when I tentatively plugged them into my phone to confirm the damage... they were fine. No issues. No degradation. These are keepers.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Ear phones
customer_reviews.text: I've updated my review after a year of ownership. These ear buds don't hold up quality wise. I now get music static from them and music playing on one side and then the other side. Fit seems to decrease as well, can't seem to keep them in place when running. I expected better quality for this much money. The sound quality when it plays through both ear buds is excellent, however.
customer_reviews.author: Lukeinashland

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, poor fit.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good (they are Bowers and Wilkins) but the fit isn't great. When they are tight in the ear the sound comes together well, but they don't stay put and need to be replaced often to get the best sound. And only working for iPhone is just annoying.
customer_reviews.author: MR B H BURROWES

customer_reviews.title: Best I have Heard!
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed the headphones for over a year. They have proven very durable and awesome. I primarily use these headphones with my iPhone/iPod. I set the EQ to treble booster due to the awesome bass output of these tiny speakers. These headphones usually live in the front pocket of my rolling computer bag. I try not to be hard on my stuff, but these headphones live in the real world, in and out of rental cars and in and out of airplanes, and my pants pocket. So far, so good. I do not regret spending the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: starr

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: They sound good and the fit is pretty good, but they're not great on either account. The fit, over long periods of time like 1-hr+, gets a fiddly and uncomfortable (can't push them too far or the metal rubs against your ear). With regard to the sound quality, the highs are a little grating. It took me a while to notice this, but it's definitely there. The sound is well balanced and with nice clarity otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Great sound...not such a great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to kill the item with a 1 star rating, because it could just be my ears. No matter what sized ear piece I used, it just didn't stay in my ears when I ran. Running is what I bought them for. When I'm sitting in my home and listening to music, the sound quality is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Neal J Magenheim

customer_reviews.title: I'm beginning to experience the crackle in one side as others have noted (likely due to a loose connection from poor quality con
customer_reviews.text: Unbalanced sound and uncomfortable to wear. The bass is loose and overpowering while the mids and highs are almost entirely non-present, leaving the overall sound feeling muddled and confused. Definitely not what you'd expect from Bowers and Wilkins. Additionally, I'm beginning to experience the crackle in one side as others have noted (likely due to a loose connection from poor quality construction). Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: littlegiant_33

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money and could use a little more bass.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely has a wide range of sound, however I had hoped for a more punching bass and they are uncomfortable after a while 20 minutes of wearing them. I loved the design, but it made them uncomfortable with the loops(even though they are adjustable). I've had $40 sony headphones that had more of a bass punch without distorting the mids and highs. They definitely are not worth $180 retail.
customer_reviews.author: carson

customer_reviews.title: finally got the fit right
customer_reviews.text: I had originally given these 4 stars, but after a slight adjustment I have changed it to 5. I was not getting enough bass and what I thought were poor sounding highs, but after a slight repositioning the sound completely changed. I am very happy with these now. If you are not blown away at first, experiment slightly turning clockwise or counterclockwise while in your ear.
customer_reviews.author: stickersteve

customer_reviews.title: Superior sound
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for working out when adjusted correctly they stay in place. And the sound of all types of music classical, rock, alternative, pop, rap, etc. Any genre of music sounds good to me when wearing these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Headphones but need some getting used to
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the most amazing headphones i have ever used and even seen. They have a beautiful shape and design. most importantly the sound quality you get is the best between headphones in this price range and even some of the more expensive ones. However, they have only one disadvantage which is the in-ear fit. The first few days you use them they hear your inner ear.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones from Amazon and Bowers & Wilkins will not honor the warranty. Extremely lame customer service. Contacted B&W several times and they kept giving me the run around. Go for the Bose SIE2i Headphones. At least they stand behind their products and they seem to be durable, especially if you plan on using these while exercising.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: You can do better
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews and bit the bullet. Couldn't wait to get these baby's in the mail and when I did - pretty disappointed. Hard to put in/on and mediocre sound (in my opinion). I bought them to replace Shures that I had before and they don't hold a candle to the Shures...
customer_reviews.author: Kent Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound
customer_reviews.text: A great set of ear headphones. Once adjusted, they stay in my ears. I am happy with the on-off switch near my face. I would purchase the headphones again. Quality product
customer_reviews.author: William Clayton Petty

customer_reviews.title: Best in-Ear headphones ever!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best in-Ear headphones in term of build and sound quality but also this unique adaptive system that fits all type/size of ear. 100% recommended.
customer_reviews.author: OTCHOUMOU AVENIE Roger

customer_reviews.title: Those little wire loops really work!
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing! Those little wire loops really work to hold the earphones in! But, if the sound wasn't good, they wouldn't be worth holding in! But, the sound is smooth and balanced, the bass is good, yet not overblown. I own several multi-armature in-ear headphones, but they are difficult to wear while commuting -- they just fall out too easily. However, these are my new first choice to commute with. They stay in and sound great!
customer_reviews.author: RSP SciFi-er

customer_reviews.title: B&W customer service is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I had these headphones for about 2 months. Sound quality was great; comfort was OK. Build quality is terrible. The inline remote has stopped working and the cable to the left earpiece appears loose - audio does not work on the left side more than half the time and unless the cable is in certain positions. Even worse, B&W has refused to service them because I did not purchase them from an authorized reseller (I purchased them at Amazon - fulfilled by Amazon, sold by someone else). B&W has lost a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Zelesko

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. The head phone is working great
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. The head phone is working great. I love the unique design. One of a kind. Long term durability is unknown, but I don't intend to abuse it.
customer_reviews.author: QuetiFifiDad

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best.
customer_reviews.text: Best of the best. It has low, sound good, sound insulation, works with my iphone. Well I can only give it 5 stars but if I could give it 6.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Sound is OK.  Fit is Awkward!
customer_reviews.text: Sound is just Ok. The earpiece takes some getting adjusted too. But in all, the sound is just OK and not really worth the struggle.
customer_reviews.author: TRSpencerMD

customer_reviews.title: Ear Phones That Don't Stay In
customer_reviews.text: I really thought these would be great, but they don't fit in your ears as they should, even trying the different sizes, still don't fit right.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is awesome, microphone for iPhone is nearly invisible. Call quality is simply awesome...sold Bose MIE2 earphones for these and so happy i did! Went through a windy street in down town Sydney, even with 50 knot winds I could still clearly hear people as I was talking to them! Great bass that come from these headphones...love them and will never go Bose again
customer_reviews.author: Sydney-DC

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I can not say anything bad about these headsets. BW did a great job. The sound is fantastic and they remain in you ear very well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Travellin'

customer_reviews.title: amazing but short lived
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for 3-4 months and the left ear bud blew. They sounded absolutely amazing while they did work. Amazing bass and sound quality. If their customer supper gets me a new pair fast I'll give 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: clarity at its best
customer_reviews.text: Beware, these headphones are addictive. Not a single day has passed by without me wanting to listen to my favorite tunes. The sensitivity and clarity of this headphone is quite remarkable. It makes you want to re-listen every song to hear the subtleties and multitude of layers which makes listening to music a complete experience.
customer_reviews.author: Nirav Malani

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: Great for train commutes. Quite stylish. Good product and easy to wear. I wish they had noise cancellation too. Overall a good pair of earphones.
customer_reviews.author: gghost

customer_reviews.title: Not for Runners
customer_reviews.text: Although these have a great fit for running, the remote is very prone to shorting when exposed to moisture (sweat, rain, etc). Once this happens they become unusable (Siri randomly pops up, songs fast forward, etc.). Would only consider for non-active uses.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Hull

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to keep my review short. This product - Bowers & Wilkins C5 - is certainly the best I've come across! But what I appreciate more is the Customer Service from the company I bought through Amazon - 24 Electronics. Thank you and Keep it up guys!
customer_reviews.author: ShopHermit

customer_reviews.title: One great in-ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product with great looks. Comfortable on the ears with great sounds. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones for sitting and listening
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality. So precise and deep bass when your properly wear it. But the loop design is useless. You cannot expect it will fit your ear when you move because the headphone and it cable is quite heavy. One more thing, my box does not have the adapter for a plane jack.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rapeepisarn

customer_reviews.title: fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Was kind of dissapointed at first saying it would take 3 weeks to get here. Ended up getting here with 5 business days. Definitely a nice surprise not to mention that they some of the best headphones that I've ever had. Bass is deep enough and the sound very crisp.
customer_reviews.author: joshua pintos

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Clean clear, great bass reponse. You can wear a motorcycle helmet comfortably with these on and no problems. Just like the rest of B&w lineup cant go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Nemrosim

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality but good service
customer_reviews.text: I've used the headphone for a year. It has been replacement twice and finally I got a refund. I think the headphone has a severe quality problem. The connection of the left-ear is very bad.
customer_reviews.author: Sen

customer_reviews.title: Control switch failed after just a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: The control switch is very fragile. The mic and volume controls stopped working. Seems others have this problem too. Sound is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: sidereal time

customer_reviews.title: Do need to search any further!
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line! Amazing sound and clarity. Extremely comfortable fit for anyone. You'll never buy another brand! I'm totally hooked, and I have tried many. Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth A. Bock

customer_reviews.title: Great In-ears!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another set that broke down. The isolation is not as good as with the old ones but the sound is very much a B&W. Nice separation and dynamics. They feel solid and well constructed. I own a set of floor standing B&W speakers and the company did not held back on quality on this headphones. Very happy with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Castre

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME !
customer_reviews.text: Though it is expensive, but it worth every penny. My soundtracks sounds way better using this than my JBL i22.
customer_reviews.author: Skillsword

customer_reviews.title: very good and fit very nicely
customer_reviews.text: great sound and very nice fitting...easy fitting system...easy to use...Nice headsets. Sound is very...looking forward to a bluetooth version to come out.
customer_reviews.author: vincent piccolomini

customer_reviews.title: wonderful sound
customer_reviews.text: I use it on the metro and I am still aware of what is going on around me.. The sound is fantastic and it does not fall off my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Monica pagano

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and the perfect fit. I really like how the adjustable cable loop onnyhebrar piece keeps it in place when I am running.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Great seller. Good headphone.
customer_reviews.text: Very good seller. The parcel was done really well! Quite good headphone, but I feel a little bit pain after long time using. Generally good. The shape is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Yang Xun

customer_reviews.title: best ear headphones ever
customer_reviews.text: best ear headphones ever! Had one pair used it for 2 years , just got a new set and they just as awesome
customer_reviews.author: Zahid alloo

customer_reviews.title: It is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Clearly, one of the most greatest earphones ever. It aint expensive as others, but as great as others. Just Splendid!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good sound but can get uncomfortable after long wear. After about a week you get used to the different design from most earbuds and grow to even prefer it.
customer_reviews.author: Sahsah24

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality
customer_reviews.text: Best earphones I've ever owned, and I'm an opera lover, so really high quality reproduction is appreciated at different ranges
customer_reviews.author: MR J N F ALISON

customer_reviews.title: Sound is Great but Highly Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The sound in these is great, however, they are horribly uncomfortable. I tried each of the four different ear buds that come with these and still couldn't find ones that felt good. I gave them to a friend who also couldn't find any way to make them comfortable so I don't think it is just my ears. These are just too big.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Keesler

customer_reviews.title: eh
customer_reviews.text: these are just ok...i like the in-ear ones with remote and mic I got at the apple store for less than half the price (not the ones that come with your iphone or iPod)
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Beautifuly made, Great sound
customer_reviews.text: but they still feel a bit insecure in my ear. I have to keep adjusting them so the sound goes in, and so they don't feel like they might fall out, which means I do not use them so much.
customer_reviews.author: feather pen

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the quality sound was suppose to be excellent (and it was!) and because my stupid gym plays its music too loud. These were marketed as noise reducing (and they are). Unfortunately, the quality of construction is poor. I am careful with these since they cost me more that 150 bones. I only wear them when I am on an elliptical trainer. But still, the right ear piece has already failed. WTF!! Is there a decent set of noise reducing quality headphones out there some where?!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: extremely average quality for the price; more expected from this brand
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Gueno

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Earphones
customer_reviews.text: I would give these earphones 4 1/2 stars overall. Great audio quality assuming you put them in your ear properly by tugging on the top of your ear while inserting them in the ear canal. Only two minor negatives . The carrying pouch is a little too small and the remote is a little quirky. I found out through trail and error and to go to the next song you have to hit the middle area twice very quickly.If you are too slow it will pause the music as if you only hit it once. Overall i haven't heard any better earphones in this price range and I consider myself a audiophile.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, bad product design.
customer_reviews.text: The sound coming out of these things is amazing. 5 stars out of 5. But honestly I hate the design. The loops that stay in your ears are constantly snapping out of the earbud and need a lot of readjusting. As well I had used them for maybe a week and the clicker you use to change songs broke after going on a run with them. After my run I went to pull the headphones out of my iPod and the wire ripped out of the plug a little. You would think earbuds as expensive as these would have some durability. If I could go back in time I probably wouldn't have bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Mason E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: product seems defective.
customer_reviews.text: there seems to be something wrong with the wire - i need to keep it in a particular position for me to get music in both the speakers. this product has now been sent to India as a gift. So, not sure how to go about getting this rectified.
customer_reviews.author: Suresh Ramaswami

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK WITH IPHONE 5
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I bought this and later discovered the controls don't work with iPhone 5. Maybe I got a defective one. Either way it's in the mail, about to be returned. Should be a disclaimer.
customer_reviews.author: RedRum

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay in ears while running
customer_reviews.text: These earphones do not stay in my ears while running, no matter what size I use. This product is of no use to me. Back to Sennheiser for me.
customer_reviews.author: Grufy

customer_reviews.title: Defective item
customer_reviews.text: I received defective a defective head phone. I tried to contact the supplier "VANNS" who asked me to directly contact Bowers and Wilkins. i did so , but haven't received any reply from them!! I am still stuck with the defective ear piece. I don't think i will ever buy anything from Bowers and Wilkins
customer_reviews.author: Aneesh

customer_reviews.title: Bowers and Wilkins C5 is a Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: Nice box, but other than that this is an awful product. The sound is tinny and the inline switch doesn't work at all. This thing is an incredible waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: cfs

product_meta.title: Bowers & Wilkins C5B In-Ear Headphones - Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Product Packaging:Standard Packaging


The Bowers & Wilkins C5 earphones deliver pristine, natural sound quality together with a secure, comfortable fit.
view larger The C5 earphones are designed to work perfectly with iPhone or iPod touch, and feature a purpose-built microphone/control cable. 
view larger C5 HEADPHONES
C5 noise-isolating in-ear headphones bring you amazingly natural acoustics and fit so comfortably and securely you'll hardly be aware you're wearing them. Bowers & Wilkins unique Micro Porous Filter system makes sure that sound is open, spacious and full of rich, lifelike detail. So you can truly lose yourself in unadulterated sound, even when you're on the move.

SECURE LOOP DESIGN
They feature Bowers & Wilkins innovative Secure Loop design - loops of plastic-coated wire that curl around the inner rim of your ears and hold the in-ear headphones firmly in place. The C5s are also Tungsten Balanced, meaning that the headphones are weighted towards your ears, rather than away from them, for optimized noise isolation.

MADE FOR IPHONE
C5's MFI remote and microphone make the headphones the perfect match for your iPod or iPhone. They also come with a quilted carrying pouch.


C5's unique Micro Porous Filter acts as a sonic diffuser, allowing the headphones to sound open, even while they isolate external noise. 
view larger C5's snug fit allows them to isolate external noise, while also keeping your music quiet to people sitting next to you – perfect for the commute into work.
view larger ADVANCED ACOUSTICS
Whatever Bowers & Wilkins make, the goal is the same: the most natural, realistic sound possible. With C5, you can take true sound with you wherever you go. C5 is a mixture of long-held acoustic principles and technological advances, key among which is the Micro Porous Filter. Together with C5's noise-isolating design, this allows users to lose themselves in flawless audio.

MICRO POROUS FILTER
If you want a spacious sound, you need room to breathe. Not a problem for a large speaker, but quite a challenge for a set of headphones small enough to fit in your ears. With C5 in-ear headphones, Bowers & Wilkins engineers got around the problem with the Micro Porous Filter. Hundreds of microscopic steel balls act as a sonic diffuser, opening up the sound and making music feel remarkably rich and expansive.

NOISE ISOLATION
C5's snug fit and stunningly realistic sound means you can forget the rest of the world and lose yourself in music. At the same time, these in-ear headphones let in just enough ambient noise to allow you to retain your sense of place. Perfect for listening to music when you're out and about.


WHICH HEADPHONE IS RIGHT FOR YOU?

Bowers & Wilkins P7 Headphones Bowers & Wilkins P5 Headphones Bowers & Wilkins P3 Headphones Bowers & Wilkins C5 Headphones Design Over-Ear On-Ear On-Ear In-Ear Changeable Ear Cushions Yes Yes Yes Yes Foldable Yes Folds flat Yes Carry Case/Pouch Yes Yes Yes Yes iPhone Compatible Yes Yes Yes Yes Weight 290g 195g 130g 20g 


The control room of Studio 1 at London's Abbey Road Studios, which uses Bowers & Wilkins 800 Series loudspeakers.
view larger Nautilus isthe result of a five-year research program to create the perfect loudspeaker. Many technologies developed in this project are now found in all Bowers & Wilkins products. 
view larger BOWERS & WILKINS HISTORY
In leading recording studios around the world, music that will soon be heard everywhere is first heard through Bowers & Wilkins loudspeakers. In London's world-famous Abbey Road Studios, all three main studios use Bowers & Wilkins 800 Series speakers to capture the output of the world's biggest-selling artists.

ENGINEERING INNOVATION
Every discovery Bowers & Wilkins' scientists make in their dedicated Research and Development facility influences how speakers all over the world are designed and built. Technologies such as Nautilus Tapering Tubes and Flowport start life in their high-end loudspeakers, but are also important factors in the likes of Zeppelin Air and their headphone range.

DOING IT FROM DAY ONE
When John Bowers set up Bowers & Wilkins in 1966, experimentation in sound and recording was escalating rapidly. It was the time of Sergeant Pepper and Pet Sounds, and Bowers had a pioneering spirit to match. His ambition was revolutionary for the day, and remains so: to create a loudspeaker that neither adds nor takes away from the music. Bowers & Wilkins has been exploring the world of sound ever since. And they'll never settle for less than perfection.

RELATED PRODUCTS FROM BOWERS & WILKINS

Bowers & Wilkins Headphones Bowers & Wilkins Wireless Music Systems Bowers & Wilkins Computer Speakers
feature_bullets: C5 delivers outstanding sound experience for people living active lifestyles.
Made for iPhone remote/microphone cable, also works with all smartphones, tablets and MP3 players (mobile devices other than compatible iOS models will not necessarily offer control functionality)
Unique adjustable Secure Loop design ensures a precise yet comfortable fit.
Micro Porous Filter acts as a sonic diffuser, opening up the sound and making music feel remarkably rich and expansive.
Bowers & Wilkins' C5 In-Ear Headphones come with a 2-year limited warranty only when purchased from an authorized dealer including Amazon.com (indicated by ships from and sold by Amazon.com).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars306 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
